data.title: Elizabeth Hurley spends New Year’s Eve with ex-husband Arun Nayar and son Damian
data.meta_description: Elizabeth Hurley cosied up next to her ex-husband Arun Nayar on New Year's Eve, making it a family affair with her son Damian close by.
data.text:
Elizabeth Hurley sports bikini on holiday with her friend

Elizabeth Hurley saw the New Year in with her son Damian as well as her ex-husband Arun Nayar.

In a cute picture shared to Damian’s Instagram Stories, Elizabeth is seen posing next to Arun at a party with the caption “Mama and daddy” with heart-eyed emojis.

The 58-year-old actress is wearing a tight sequin dress, showing off her long legs and strappy silver heels.

Meanwhile, her 59-year-old ex-husband Arun, who is a multi-millionaire textile heir, was dressed up to the nines in a tailored black suit.

It isn’t clear where the party took place, but going by the image’s backdrop it looks like the family-of-three could have spent it at a pub or restaurant.

Read more: Elizabeth Hurley's 'cheeky' snap as she teases fans in fluffy white robe

Hurley and Nayar were last seen together in August last year when they both attended Damian’s graduation from drama school.

He shared a snap at the time with him standing between them both with the caption: “Mama and Daddyo at graduation with mee!”

Hurley and Nayar got married in 2007 but it wasn’t to last as they divorced in 2011, nevertheless, they have remained good friends.

Biologically, Nayar is not Damian’s father but The Bedazzled actress has always said publicly that she thinks of him as his dad, considering they tied the knot when he was five.

In an interview with YOU magazine in 2018, the actress stated: “Arun is Damian’s daddy and a very good one too, they see each other a lot.”

Damian’s biological father was actually a movie producer, the late Steve Bing, who died by suicide on June 22, 2020, aged 55.

Hurley had an 18-month relationship with the millionaire businessman in the early 2000s but split up following a dramatic paternity test which confirmed he was Damian’s dad.

It had been reported that he never met his son but Hurley confirmed following his death that the pair did meet.

She told YOU how they grew closer and had spoken on Damian’s 18th birthday.

Hurley added in 2020: “It had been great to connect again. We hadn’t been friends for a very long time, but about a year and a half ago he came back into our lives.

“It’s very sad… just terrible. Horrific that it happened but there is some comfort to know we had made up and there was no bad feeling.”
